newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico May department store sales climb - INEGI.
newsitem.headline: Mexico May department store sales climb - INEGI.

text.p: Department store sales in Mexico rose an average of 5.7 percent in real terms in May 1997 compared with the same month last year, government data showed on Tuesday.
Positive results from 15 of the 28 cities surveyed helped boost the figures, Mexico's INEGI National Statistics Institute said.
Although it said this was the fourth consecutive monthly increase, the level of sales was still 29 percent below the 1994 average, the figures showed.

Of Mexico's three biggest cities, Guadalajara showed the biggest increase, tallying 10.2 percent over May 1996. Mexico City climbed 5.0 percent while the northern industrial capital Monterrey recorded a 0.6 percent fall.
INEGI said that in the first five months of the year, department store sales grew 3.0 percent compared with the same period in 1996.
((--Tomas De La Rosa, Mexico City newsroom +525 728 7912))
